alert.note: Alert for Upper Koyukuk Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 2:10PM AKST until January 22 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Southwest winds 15 to 25 mph with gust to 35 mph over the highway summits will reduce visibility to one half mile or less at times. Wind chill values as low as 50 below are expected. * WHERE...Upper Koyukuk Valley. * WHEN...From 6 AM this morning to 3 AM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 50 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Significant blowing and drifting of snow is expected. Wind chill values as low as 50 below are expected.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
